name: 31 Defeated Kings
summary: List of 31 Canaanite kings defeated by Joshua during the conquest of the Promised Land.

name: Aaron
summary: First High Priest of Israel, spokesman for Moses, brother of Moses and Miriam.

name: Abdon
summary: Judge who had 40 sons and 30 grandsons, judged Israel for 8 years.

name: Abel
summary: Second son of Adam and Eve, first martyr, righteous shepherd

name: Abiathar
summary: Only priest to escape Saul's massacre at Nob, became David's priest

name: Abigail
summary: Wise woman who prevented David from sinning by interceding for her foolish husband Nabal

name: Abihu
summary: Second son of Aaron, priest who offered unauthorized fire and died.

name: Abimelech
summary: Son of Gideon who murdered his brothers and made himself king, killed by a millstone.

name: Abinadab (Ark keeper)
summary: Man whose house at Kiriath-jearim housed the ark for 20 years

name: Abishag
summary: Shunammite woman who cared for elderly King David

name: Abner
summary: Saul's military commander who made Ish-bosheth king, later defected to David

name: Abraham
summary: Father of faith, covenant recipient, and patriarch of Israel. His journey from Ur to Canaan exemplifies faith and obedience

name: Absalom
summary: David's third son who rebelled against his father and was killed by Joab

name: Achan
summary: Israelite who took forbidden plunder from Jericho, bringing defeat at Ai and judgment upon himself and his family.

name: Achish
summary: Philistine king of Gath who gave David refuge during his flight from Saul

name: Achsah
summary: Daughter of Caleb who boldly requested springs of water as inheritance, demonstrating wisdom and initiative.

name: Adam
summary: First human created by God, placed in Eden, father of humanity

name: Adoni-zedek
summary: King of Jerusalem who led coalition of five kings against Gibeon and Israel, defeated when God made the sun stand still.

name: Adonijah
summary: David's fourth son, later attempted to seize throne from Solomon

name: Ahasuerus (Xerxes I)
summary: Persian king whose volatile temper and susceptibility to counsel drives the plot—deposing Vashti, elevating Haman, then reversing course to save the Jews.

name: Ahimelech
summary: High priest at Nob who helped David and was killed by Saul

name: Ahinoam of Jezreel
summary: One of David's wives, taken captive by Amalekites and rescued

name: Ahithophel
summary: David's wise counselor who joined Absalom's rebellion and committed suicide

name: Amaziah (Priest of Bethel)
summary: Priest of Bethel who confronted Amos, accused him of conspiracy against Jeroboam II, and ordered him to return to Judah—receiving a devastating personal prophecy of judgment in response.

name: Amnon
summary: David's firstborn who raped his half-sister Tamar and was killed by Absalom

name: Amos
summary: Shepherd and fig tree farmer from Tekoa in Judah who was called by God to prophesy against the Northern Kingdom of Israel during the reign of Jeroboam II, exposing religious hypocrisy, condemning social injustice, and announcing the Day of the Lord.

name: Amram
summary: Father of Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, husband of Jochebed.

name: Ancient of Days
meaning: Ancient of Days / One Advanced in Days
summary: The eternal God enthroned in heaven's courtroom with white clothing, white hair, and a fiery throne with wheels. He judges the beastly empires and gives everlasting dominion to the Son of Man.

name: Araunah the Jebusite
summary: Jebusite who sold his threshing floor to David for an altar

name: Asenath
summary: Egyptian wife of Joseph, daughter of priest of On, mother of Manasseh and Ephraim

name: Athaliah
summary: Daughter of Ahab/Jezebel, usurper queen of Judah, killed royal seed

name: Azariah (Abednego)
meaning: Yahweh has helped / Servant of Nebo
summary: One of Daniel's three faithful companions who refused to worship Nebuchadnezzar's golden image and survived the fiery furnace.

name: Balaam (referenced)
summary: False prophet killed by Israel, mentioned as one who tried to curse Israel but was prevented by God.

name: Barak
summary: Military commander under Deborah who led Israel's army against Sisera.

name: Bathsheba
summary: David's wife, Solomon's mother, secures throne for her son

name: Bathsheba
summary: Woman David took in adultery, became his wife and mother of Solomon

name: Belshazzar
summary: Last Babylonian king who desecrated temple vessels at his feast, saw the writing on the wall, and was killed the night Babylon fell.

name: Benjamin
summary: Youngest son of Jacob, Rachel's second son, brother beloved by Joseph

name: Bezalel
summary: Chief artisan of the Tabernacle, filled with the Spirit of God for craftsmanship.

name: Bigthana and Teresh
summary: Two eunuchs who guarded the king's door and plotted to assassinate Ahasuerus; exposed by Mordecai and executed by hanging.

name: Bilhah
summary: Rachel's servant, mother of Dan and Naphtali through surrogacy arrangement

name: Boaz
summary: Kinsman-redeemer who married Ruth, showing kindness and fulfilling the law. Ancestor of David and Jesus.

name: Cain
summary: First son of Adam and Eve, first murderer, builder of first city

name: Caleb
summary: One of two faithful spies (with Joshua) who encouraged Israel to enter Promised Land.

name: Chilion
summary: Son of Elimelech and Naomi, husband of Orpah who died in Moab.

name: Commander of the LORD's Army
summary: Divine figure who appeared to Joshua before Jericho, often identified as a theophany or the pre-incarnate Christ.

name: Cyrus
summary: Persian king who conquered Babylon and allowed the Jews to return from exile.

name: Daniel
summary: Exiled Jewish prophet and wise man in Babylon who remained faithful to God, interpreted dreams and visions, and received apocalyptic revelations about kingdoms and the Son of Man.

name: Darius the Mede
summary: Medo-Persian ruler under whom Daniel served and was thrown into the lions' den due to a conspiracy by jealous officials.

name: Daughters of Jerusalem
summary: Female chorus who witness and affirm the love between the couple, receive confidences, ask questions, and are charged not to awaken love prematurely.

name: Daughters of Zelophehad
summary: Five sisters (Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, Tirzah) who successfully claimed their inheritance rights in Manasseh.

name: David
summary: Shepherd boy anointed as king, giant-killer, musician, man after God's own heart who fell into sin

name: Deborah
summary: Prophet, judge, and military leader. The only female judge who led Israel to victory over Canaanite oppression.

name: Delilah
summary: Philistine woman who betrayed Samson. Her story explores themes of deception, weakness, and divine sovereignty.

name: Dinah
summary: Daughter of Jacob and Leah, central figure in conflict with Shechem

name: Doeg the Edomite
summary: Edomite who betrayed David to Saul and massacred the priests of Nob

name: Ehud
summary: Left-handed judge from Benjamin who assassinated Eglon king of Moab.

name: Eleazar
summary: Third son of Aaron, became High Priest after Aaron's death.

name: Eli
summary: High priest who raised Samuel but failed to discipline his corrupt sons

name: Eliezer
summary: Abraham's trusted servant who found a wife for Isaac

name: Elijah
summary: Greatest prophet of northern kingdom, confronted Ahab and Jezebel, taken to heaven in whirlwind

name: Elimelech
summary: Naomi's husband who took his family to Moab during famine and died there.

name: Elisha
summary: Elijah's successor, performed many miracles and helped common people

name: Elkanah
summary: Hannah's husband, father of Samuel, faithful worshipper at Shiloh

name: Elon
summary: Judge from Zebulun who judged Israel for 10 years.

name: Esau/Edom
summary: Twin brother of Jacob who sold his birthright, father of the Edomites

name: Esther
summary: Jewish orphan raised by Mordecai who became Queen of Persia and courageously risked her life to save her people from Haman's genocidal plot.

name: Eve
summary: First woman, created as ʿēzer kĕnegdô (corresponding strength), co-image bearer with Adam, archetypal wife and mother, recipient of proto-evangelium. Her narrative establishes patterns of temptation, exile, and redemptive hope that echo throughout Scripture

name: Gabriel
summary: Angelic messenger who explained Daniel's visions, particularly the seventy sevens prophecy.

name: Gehazi
summary: Elisha's servant who was struck with leprosy for greed

name: Gideon
summary: Judge who defeated the Midianites with 300 men, demonstrating God's power through weakness.

name: Goliath
summary: Philistine giant champion defeated by David with a sling and stone

name: Gomer
summary: Wife of prophet Hosea, living metaphor of Israel's unfaithfulness to God. Her story of betrayal and redemption illustrates God's persistent love.

name: Hagar
summary: Egyptian servant who became mother of Ishmael. Her encounters with God reveal His compassion for the marginalized

name: Haggith
summary: Mother of Adonijah, David's wife

name: Haman
summary: Agagite official elevated by Ahasuerus who plotted genocide against the Jews due to Mordecai's refusal to bow, ultimately executed on his own gallows.

name: Hamutal
summary: Mother of kings Jehoahaz and Zedekiah

name: Hananiah (Shadrach)
summary: One of Daniel's three faithful companions who refused to worship Nebuchadnezzar's golden image and survived the fiery furnace.

name: Hannah
summary: Barren woman whose fervent prayer led to Samuel's birth. Her song of praise became a model for the Magnificat.

name: Harbona
summary: One of the king's eunuchs who pointed out Haman's gallows built for Mordecai, leading to Haman's execution on his own device.

name: Hatach
summary: Eunuch assigned to attend Esther who served as messenger between her and Mordecai during the crisis over Haman's decree.

name: Hegai
summary: Keeper of the king's harem who favored Esther and provided her with special beauty treatments and the best place in the house of women.

name: Hezekiah
summary: Righteous king who trusted God against Assyrian invasion

name: Hoglah
summary: Hoglah, one of the five daughters of Zelophehad; co-claimant to her father's inheritance, setting precedent for Israel's inheritance law.

name: Hophni and Phinehas
summary: Eli's corrupt sons who abused their priestly office and died in battle

name: Hosea
summary: Prophet to the Northern Kingdom who lived out God's message through his marriage to unfaithful Gomer, demonstrating God's persistent love for Israel.

name: Huldah
summary: Prophetess consulted by King Josiah about the Book of the Law

name: Hur
summary: Supported Moses' arms during battle with Amalek, leader of Judah, grandfather of Bezalel.

name: Hushai the Archite
summary: David's friend who stayed in Jerusalem to counter Ahithophel's counsel

name: Ibzan
summary: Judge from Bethlehem who had 30 sons and 30 daughters.

name: Isaac
summary: Son of promise, father of Jacob and Esau, patriarch who carried forward the Abrahamic covenant

name: Ish-bosheth
summary: Saul's son made king by Abner, weak ruler assassinated by his own men

name: Ishmael
summary: Son of Abraham and Hagar, father of twelve princes, ancestor of Arab nations

name: Ithamar
summary: Youngest son of Aaron, supervised Tabernacle construction, founder of priestly line.

name: Jabin of Hazor
summary: King of Hazor who led northern coalition against Israel, defeated by Joshua at Waters of Merom.

name: Jacob/Israel
summary: Patriarch who wrestled with God, father of twelve tribes, renamed Israel

name: Jael
summary: Wife of Heber the Kenite who killed Sisera, fulfilling Deborah's prophecy.

name: Jair
summary: Judge from Gilead who had 30 sons, judged Israel for 22 years.

name: Jehosheba
summary: Daughter of King Joram, saved baby Joash from Athaliah

name: Jehu
summary: Anointed king who destroyed Ahab's dynasty and killed Jezebel

name: Jephthah
summary: Judge who made a rash vow, delivered Israel from Ammonites.

name: Jephthah's Daughter
summary: Unnamed daughter sacrificed due to her father's rash vow, mourned annually by Israel's daughters.

name: Jeroboam II
meaning: The people contend / May the people multiply
summary: King of Israel during Amos's ministry who presided over a period of unprecedented prosperity and territorial expansion, yet whose reign was marked by idolatry and social injustice that provoked divine judgment.

name: Jeroboam's Wife
summary: Sought prophet Ahijah in disguise about sick son

name: Jesse
summary: David's father, Bethlehemite shepherd who presented his sons to Samuel

name: Jethro/Reuel
summary: Priest of Midian, Moses' father-in-law, advised Moses on delegation and governance.

name: Jezebel
summary: Ahab's wife, promoted Baal worship, enemy of Elijah, killed by Jehu's command

name: Jezreel
summary: First son of Hosea and Gomer, his name prophesied judgment on Jehu's house for the bloodshed at Jezreel.

name: Joab
summary: David's nephew and military commander, ruthless but loyal, killed Abner and Absalom

name: Joash (Judah)
summary: Child king saved by Jehosheba, repaired the temple

name: Jochebed
summary: Mother of Moses, Aaron, and Miriam who saved Moses by placing him in the Nile.

name: Jonathan
summary: Saul's son and David's loyal friend who chose friendship over succession

name: Joseph
summary: Favorite son of Jacob, dreamer, sold into slavery, became vizier of Egypt, saved his family from famine

name: Joshua
summary: Moses' assistant and military leader, later succeeded Moses as leader of Israel.

name: Josiah
summary: Great reformer king who discovered the Book of the Law

name: Judah
summary: Fourth son of Jacob and Leah, ancestor of David and Jesus, showed leadership in Joseph story

name: King Lemuel's Mother
summary: Royal mother who delivered prophetic oracle on just kingship and defending the vulnerable

name: Kish
summary: Saul's father, wealthy Benjamite who sent Saul to find lost donkeys

name: Laban
summary: Brother of Rebekah, father of Leah and Rachel, Jacob's father-in-law

name: Lady Folly
summary: Personification of folly, chaos, and temptation; dark counterpart to Lady Wisdom

name: Lady Wisdom
summary: Personification of divine wisdom appearing as prophetic teacher who calls humanity to life

name: Leah
summary: First wife of Jacob, mother of six sons and one daughter, including Judah and Levi

name: Levi
summary: Third son of Jacob and Leah, ancestor of priestly tribe

name: Levite's Concubine
summary: Unnamed woman whose death sparked civil war in Israel.

name: Lo-Ammi
summary: Second son of Hosea and Gomer, his name symbolized Israel's broken covenant relationship with God.

name: Lo-Ruhamah
summary: Daughter of Hosea and Gomer, her name symbolized God's withdrawal of mercy from Israel.

name: Lot
summary: Abraham's nephew who chose the plains of Jordan, survived Sodom's destruction

name: Lot's Daughters
summary: Unnamed daughters who, after Sodom's destruction, preserved their family line through their father, becoming mothers of Moab and Ammon

name: Lot's Wife
summary: Unnamed woman who looked back at Sodom and became a pillar of salt

name: Mahlah
meaning: Sickness/Disease (often interpreted charitably in later tradition)
summary: Mahlah, one of the five daughters of Zelophehad; co-claimant to her father's inheritance, setting precedent for Israel's inheritance law.

name: Mahlon
summary: Son of Elimelech and Naomi, first husband of Ruth who died in Moab.

name: Manasseh
summary: Most wicked king of Judah who led nation into idolatry

name: Manoah
summary: Father of Samson, received angelic visitation announcing Samson's birth.

name: Manoah's Wife
summary: Mother of Samson who received angelic visitation, showed greater faith than her husband.

name: Medium of En-dor
summary: Necromancer consulted by Saul who summoned Samuel's spirit before his final battle

name: Melchizedek
summary: Mysterious priest-king of Salem who blessed Abraham, type of Christ

name: Memucan
summary: One of the seven princes of Persia who advised King Ahasuerus to depose Vashti and issue the empire-wide decree about male authority.

name: Mephibosheth
summary: Jonathan's lame son shown kindness by David for Jonathan's sake

name: Merab
summary: Saul's eldest daughter, promised to David but given to Adriel

name: Micah
summary: Ephraimite who made idols and hired a Levite as his personal priest.

name: Michael
summary: Angelic prince and protector of Israel, engaged in spiritual warfare, defender of God's people in the final conflict.

name: Michal
summary: Saul's daughter who loved David, helped him escape, later given to another man

name: Milcah
summary: Milcah, one of the five daughters of Zelophehad; co-claimant to her father's inheritance, setting precedent for Israel's inheritance law.

name: Miriam
summary: Prophetess, sister of Moses and Aaron, led women in worship after crossing the Red Sea.

name: Mishael (Meshach)
meaning: Who is what God is? / (Babylonian: uncertain)
summary: One of Daniel's three faithful companions who refused to worship Nebuchadnezzar's golden image and survived the fiery furnace.

name: Mordecai
summary: Benjamite exile who raised Esther, uncovered an assassination plot, refused to bow to Haman, and became second to the king after Jewish deliverance.

name: Moses
summary: Prophet, lawgiver, and deliverer of Israel from Egypt. Central figure in the Exodus and covenant at Sinai.

name: Naaman
summary: Syrian commander healed of leprosy by following Elisha's instructions

name: Naaman's Wife
summary: Syrian officer's wife, mistress of Israelite servant girl

name: Naaman's Wife's Servant Girl
summary: Israelite captive who directed Naaman to Elisha for healing

name: Nabal
summary: Wealthy but foolish man whose rudeness to David nearly caused disaster

name: Nadab
summary: Eldest son of Aaron, priest who offered unauthorized fire and died.

name: Naomi
summary: Mother-in-law of Ruth who returned from Moab to Bethlehem after tragedy, orchestrated Ruth's redemption through Boaz.

name: Nathan the Prophet
summary: Prophet who gave David the covenant promises and confronted him about his sin with Bathsheba

name: Nebuchadnezzar
summary: King of Babylon who conquered Jerusalem, experienced humbling and restoration after becoming beast-like, eventually acknowledged God's sovereignty.

name: Nehushta
summary: Mother of King Jehoiachin

name: Noah
summary: Righteous man who built the ark, saved humanity and animals from the flood

name: Noah
summary: Noah, one of the five daughters of Zelophehad; co-claimant to her father's inheritance, setting precedent for Israel's inheritance law.

name: Obed
summary: Son of Boaz and Ruth, grandfather of King David, in the lineage of Jesus.

name: Og
summary: King of Bashan, last of the Rephaim giants, defeated by Moses. His territory given to half-tribe of Manasseh.

name: Oholiab
summary: Assistant to Bezalel in constructing the Tabernacle, skilled craftsman from tribe of Dan.

name: Orpah
summary: Moabite daughter-in-law of Naomi who returned to her people and gods, contrasting with Ruth's faith.

name: Othniel
summary: Caleb's nephew who captured Kiriath-sepher and married Achsah, later became first judge of Israel.

name: Othniel
summary: First judge of Israel, nephew of Caleb, delivered Israel from Mesopotamian oppression.

name: Peninnah
summary: Elkanah's second wife who had children and provoked Hannah's barrenness

name: Pharaoh (Joseph's)
summary: Egyptian ruler who had prophetic dreams, elevated Joseph to second in command

name: Pharaoh (of the Exodus)
summary: Egyptian ruler who enslaved Israel and refused to let them go, experiencing the ten plagues.

name: Pharaoh's Daughter
summary: Egyptian princess who rescued and adopted Moses, raising him in Pharaoh's household.

name: Pharaoh's Daughter's Maidservant
summary: Unnamed Egyptian servant who retrieved Moses' basket from the Nile at Pharaoh's daughter's command, becoming the sixth woman in Exodus 1-2 who preserves Moses' life.

name: Phinehas
summary: Son of Eleazar the priest who helped resolve the altar dispute with the Trans-Jordan tribes.

name: Potiphar
summary: Egyptian official who bought Joseph as a slave, captain of Pharaoh's guard

name: Potiphar's Wife
summary: Unnamed woman who attempted to seduce Joseph and falsely accused him

name: Puah
summary: Hebrew midwife who defied Pharaoh's orders to kill Hebrew baby boys (profiled with Shiphrah).

name: Queen of Sheba
summary: Foreign queen who visited Solomon to test his wisdom

name: Rachel
summary: Beloved wife of Jacob, mother of Joseph and Benjamin, died in childbirth

name: Rahab
summary: Canaanite prostitute who protected Israelite spies and joined God's people through faith, becoming an ancestor of David and Jesus.

name: Rahab's Mother
summary: Unnamed Canaanite woman saved through her daughter Rahab's faith when Jericho fell, demonstrating God's household salvation.

name: Rebekah
summary: Wife of Isaac, mother of Jacob and Esau, demonstrated hospitality and divine guidance

name: Reuben
summary: Firstborn of Jacob and Leah, lost birthright due to sin, tried to save Joseph

name: Rizpah
summary: Saul's concubine who protected her sons' bodies after execution

name: Ruth
summary: Moabite woman who chose faith in God and loyalty to Naomi, became ancestor of David and Jesus through her marriage to Boaz.

name: Samson
summary: Judge with supernatural strength, Nazirite from birth, delivered Israel from Philistines.

name: Samuel
summary: Last judge and first prophet, anointed both Saul and David as kings

name: Sarah
summary: Mother of nations, wife of Abraham. Her story demonstrates faith through struggle with infertility and God's promise fulfillment

name: Saul
summary: First king of Israel, chosen by people's demand, rejected by God for disobedience

name: Shamgar
summary: Judge who killed 600 Philistines with an ox goad.

name: Shimei
summary: Benjamite who cursed David during Absalom's rebellion, later begged forgiveness

name: Shiphrah
summary: Hebrew midwife who defied Pharaoh's orders to kill Hebrew baby boys (profiled with Puah).

name: Shunammite Woman
summary: Wealthy patron of Elisha, son raised from dead

name: Sihon
summary: Amorite king defeated by Moses, his territory given to Reuben and Gad.

name: Simeon
summary: Second son of Jacob and Leah, involved in revenge for Dinah

name: Sisera
summary: Canaanite army commander defeated by Deborah and Barak, killed by Jael.

name: Solomon
summary: Son of David and Bathsheba, loved by the Lord, future king

name: Solomon
summary: King of Israel whose wealth and many wives are contrasted with authentic covenant love. His vineyard worth thousands is rejected for love that cannot be bought.

name: Tahpenes
summary: Egyptian queen, Pharaoh's wife, gave sister to Hadad

name: Tamar
summary: Daughter-in-law of Judah who secured her rights through bold action, ancestor of David

name: Tamar
summary: Solomon's daughter, married to Ben-abinadab

name: Tamar
summary: David's daughter raped by her half-brother Amnon, avenged by Absalom

name: Tamar (Absalom's daughter)
summary: Absalom's beautiful daughter, named after his sister

name: Ten Sons of Haman
summary: Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha, Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai, and Vaizatha—killed when Jews defended themselves and later hanged publicly.

name: The Adulteress
summary: Warning figure representing sexual temptation and covenant unfaithfulness

name: The Beloved Man
summary: Male lover who praises his beloved's beauty, expresses passionate desire, and engages in mutual dialogue of love throughout the Song.

name: The Beloved Woman
summary: Primary voice in Song of Songs who speaks more than any other character, expressing desire, longing, and celebration of love. Embodies female agency and teaches that love is as strong as death and a flame of Yah.

name: The Contentious Woman
summary: Negative archetype of quarrelsome behavior destroying household peace

name: The Excellent Wife (Eshet Chayil)
summary: Ideal portrait of wisdom embodied in everyday life through economic enterprise and family care

name: The Fool and Wicked Man
summary: Negative archetype embodying rejection of wisdom and divine order

name: The Foolish Woman
summary: Woman who tears down her house with her own hands

name: The Gibeonites
summary: Canaanite people who deceived Joshua into making a treaty, becoming servants but preserving their lives.

name: The Gracious Woman
summary: Woman who obtains honor through graciousness

name: The King
summary: Leadership under divine wisdom, practicing justice and protecting the vulnerable

name: The Mother in Proverbs
meaning: Mother (from root meaning 'to be firm, supportive')
summary: Co-teacher with father whose instruction (torah) carries divine authority

name: The Righteous Man
summary: Ideal of covenant faithfulness lived out in everyday life

name: The Scoffer/Mocker
summary: Arrogant person who mocks wisdom and resists correction

name: The Shulammite
summary: Only explicitly named woman in Song of Songs, appearing at crucial moments. Rejects Solomon's wealth for true love, demonstrating that authentic love transcends material wealth and power.

name: The Simple One
summary: Inexperienced person vulnerable to deception, needing wisdom

name: The Sluggard
summary: Warning figure embodying sloth and its destructive consequences

name: The Son (Learner)
summary: Silent addressee representing every learner choosing between wisdom and folly

name: The Watchmen
summary: City guards who encounter the beloved during her nighttime searches. In one instance they beat her, representing corrupted authority and obstacles to love.

name: The Wise Father
summary: Primary wisdom teacher delivering ten instructional discourses to his son

name: The Wise Woman
summary: Woman who builds her house through wisdom

name: Tirzah
summary: Tirzah, one of the five daughters of Zelophehad; co-claimant to her father's inheritance, setting precedent for Israel's inheritance law.

name: Tola
summary: Judge from Issachar who judged Israel for 23 years.

name: Two Spies
summary: Unnamed spies sent by Joshua to Jericho, protected by Rahab. Tradition identifies them as Caleb's son and Phinehas.

name: Unnamed Kinsman-Redeemer
summary: Closer relative who declined to redeem Ruth, allowing Boaz to fulfill the role.

name: Uriah the Hittite
summary: Loyal soldier and Bathsheba's husband, murdered by David's arrangement

name: Uzziah (Azariah)
meaning: Yahweh is my strength / Yahweh has helped
summary: King of Judah during Amos's ministry, contemporary of Jeroboam II, whose long reign was generally prosperous until pride led to his downfall when he unlawfully burned incense in the temple.

name: Vashti
summary: Persian queen whose refusal to display herself at the king's drunken feast led to her deposition, creating the vacancy that brought Esther to the throne.

name: Widow of Zarephath
summary: Fed Elijah during famine, son raised from dead

name: Woman of Abel Beth-maacah
summary: Wise woman who saved her city by handing over Sheba's head to Joab

name: Woman of Tekoa
summary: Woman hired by Joab to convince David to bring back Absalom through a parable

name: Woman of Thebez
summary: Unnamed woman who killed Abimelech by dropping a millstone on his head.

name: Zebidah
summary: Mother of King Jehoiakim

name: Zeresh
summary: Haman's wife who advised building the gallows for Mordecai, then prophetically warned Haman of his downfall when she learned Mordecai was Jewish.

name: Zeruah
summary: Jeroboam's mother, widow

name: Ziba
summary: Saul's former servant who deceived David about Mephibosheth's loyalty

name: Zilpah
summary: Leah's servant, mother of Gad and Asher through surrogacy arrangement

name: Zipporah
summary: Wife of Moses, daughter of Jethro, saved Moses' life through circumcision of their son.
